~Proficiency Training~.Effect:
Choose and gain Proficiency in any type of activity (see Proficiencies).
You can get this Feat multiple times (for different Proficiencies, obviously).
~Proficiency Training~.Name: ~Proficiency Training~

~Weapon Training~.Effect:
You become Trained in any of the following weapon categories (choose one):
- 1-Handed Melee Weapons
- 2-Handed Melee Weapons
- 1-Handed Ranged Weapons
- 2-Handed Ranged Weapons
- Shields
You can get this Feat multiple times.
~Weapon Training~.Name: ~Weapon Training~

~Magic Initiate~.Effect: Choose one more Basic Ability List to gain access to.
~Magic Initiate~.Name: ~Magic Initiate~

~Darkvision~.Effect: Your eyes are well adapted to dark environments, and you can see up to 15 meters away in darkness, without discerning colors.
~Darkvision~.Name: ~Darkvision~

~Mastery~.Effect: When attacking with a weapon, instead of adding Might or Dexterity, you can add either Sense or Charisma.
~Mastery~.Notes:
For example, a Mace attack can become 1d6 + Sense (or 1d6 + Charisma) instead of 1d6 + Might.
You can only replace Might or Dexterity once per attack. For example, a Longbow attack could be 1d8 + Dexterity + Sense (or Charisma) instead of 1d8 + 2 * Dexterity. You still need to be Trained in that weapon to use it properly. Also called Soelluelegh, or however it's spelled.
~Mastery~.Name: ~Mastery~

~Battle Mage~.Effect: When attacking with a weapon, instead of adding Might or Dexterity, you can add Intelligence. If you do, The attack's Damage becomes Fire, Cold or Shock (of choice).
~Battle Mage~.Notes:
For example, a Mace attack can become 1d6 + Intelligence instead of 1d6 + Might.
You can only replace Might or Dexterity once per attack. For example, a Longbow attack could be 1d8 + Dexterity + Intelligence instead of 1d8 + 2 * Dexterity. You still need to be Trained in that weapon to use it properly. Also called Soelluelegh, or however it's spelled.
~Battle Mage~.Upgrade: This can only happen if you're wearing Heavy Armor.
~Battle Mage~.Name: ~Battle Mage~

~Double Greatweapon Fighting~.Requirement: Trained in 2-Handed melee weapons and at least 2 Might
~Double Greatweapon Fighting~.Effect:
You can dual wield 2-Handed melee weapons, one in each hand.
If you make weapon attacks like this, each attack takes only Half-Action and does -5 Damage.
When dual wielding them, if any Ability tells you to perform an attack with a 2-Handed and the ability costs 1 Action, it costs only Half-Action.
~Double Greatweapon Fighting~.Notes:
Alternatively, you can wield a Shield in one hand and a 2-Handed melee weapon in the other.
You need Training in Shields to do this.
~Double Greatweapon Fighting~.Name: ~Double Greatweapon Fighting~

~Highlander Technique~.Effect:
You can wield 1-Handed melee weapons with both hands.
If you do, your 2-Handed weapon attacks with 1-Handed melee weapons take 1 Action and deal an extra +2d6 Damage.
~Highlander Technique~.Name: ~Highlander Technique~

~Tower Shield Training~.Requirement: Trained in Shields, at least 2 Might
~Tower Shield Training~.Effect:
You can wield a Tower Shield.
A Tower Shield gives you a +1 Defense bonus, but reduces your Movement Speed by 2.
~Tower Shield Training~.Notes: Check the Weapons list for the stats of a Tower Shield. Check the Shop to see the price of a Tower Shield.
~Tower Shield Training~.Name: ~Tower Shield Training~

~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Requirements: Trained in Shields, at least 2 Might
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Effect:
You can wield a Shield in each hand. If you do, you gain an extra +1 Defense, in addition to what the Shield normally gives.
Attacks with a normal Shield now deal 1d6 + ^Might^ Damage (and the Shield counts as a weapon you're Trained in).
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Upgrade:
If you have Tower Shield Training, you can dual-wield Tower Shields (or a normal Shield and a Tower Shield).
Each Shield gives you its boon, aside from the +1 Defense of this Feat (e.g. Shield + Tower Shield = 50% Pierce Resistance, +1 Defense from the Tower Shield, +1 Defense from this Feat).
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Name: ~Shield Dual-Wielding~

~Throwing Expert~.Effect: You can throw melee weapons at up to 5 meters range and with their own damage and effects. Thrown 1-Handed Weapons have a -2 Penalty and 2-Handed Weapons a -4 Penalty.
~Throwing Expert~.Name: ~Throwing Expert~

~Blindness~.Effect:
You are blind in your eyes, but can understand your surroundings using your other senses.
You fail all Checks for seeing (or related), but gain Proficiency in Hearing and Smelling.
You are immune to being Blinded and take only 50% Psychic Damage (after subtracting Defense).
~Blindness~.Name: ~Blindness~

~Deafness~.Effect:
You are deaf in your ears, but can read lips and sense the rest of your surroundings using your other senses.
You fail all Checks for hearing (or related), but gain Proficiency in Sight and Smelling.
You are immune to being Silenced and take only 50% Psychic Damage (after subtracting Defense).
~Deafness~.Name: ~Deafness~

~MC - Cleric~.Effect: You gain the Awe, Spread the Awe and Blessing Abilities from the Cleric Class and access to the Divine Ability List.
~MC - Cleric~.Name: ~MC - Cleric~

~MC - Druid~.Effect:
You gain the Shapeshift and Druidcraft Abilities from the Druid and access to the Nature Ability List.
The next time when you would pick a Talent from your original class, you can instead gain a Druid Specialization and all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Druid~.Name: ~MC - Druid~

~MC - Hunter~.Effect: You gain the Animal Companion Talent from any Hunter Specialization and access to either the Nature or the Warfare Ability List.
~MC - Hunter~.Name: ~MC - Hunter~

~MC - Mage~.Effect:
You gain the Magic Mastery Ability from the Mage and access to the Elemental, Conjuration and Arcane Basic Ability Lists.
The next time when you would pick a Talent from your original class, you can instead pick a Mage Specialization and gain all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Mage~.Name: ~MC - Mage~

~MC - Paladin~.Effect:
You gain the Divine Sense, Lay on Hands and Divine Smite Abilities from the Paladin and access to the Divine and Warfare Ability Lists.
At any point from Level 2 on, you can further sacrifice 1 more Max Mana to gain a Paladin Specialization and all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Paladin~.Upgrade: You must permanently sacrifice 2 of your Max Mana to get this Feat.
~MC - Paladin~.Name: ~MC - Paladin~

~MC - Rogue~.Effect:
You gain the Ambush and Hide Abilities from the Rogue, and access to the Bloodshed and Warfare Ability Lists.
At any point from Level 2 on, you can further sacrifice 2 more Max Mana to gain a Rogue Specialization and all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Rogue~.Name: ~MC - Rogue~

~MC - Shaman~.Effect:
You gain the Animal Spirit Ability (and thus one spirit animal Ability) from the Shaman and access to the Bloodshed and Mysticism Ability Lists.
The next time when you would pick a Talent from your original class, you can instead pick a Shaman Specialization and gain all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Shaman~.Upgrade: You must permanently sacrifice 1 of your Max Mana to get this Feat.
~MC - Shaman~.Name: ~MC - Shaman~

~MC - Warlock~.Effect:
You gain the Power Tap Ability from the Warlock, as well as a patron Ability, and access to the Eldritch Basic Ability List.
Furthermore, you gain 1 special Warlock Mana that regenerates after every Worthy Combat Encounter, as if it were a normal Mana point for the Warlock.
~MC - Warlock~.Upgrade: You must permanently sacrifice 3 of your Max Mana and 3 of your Max Health to get this Feat.
~MC - Warlock~.Name: ~MC - Warlock~

~MC - Warrior~.Effect:
You gain the Advanced Flank and Rout Abilities, Training in all weapons and access to the Bloodshed and Warfare Ability Lists.
At any point from Level 2 on, you can further sacrifice 1 more Max Mana to gain a Warrior Specialization and all of its starting Abilities.
~MC - Warrior~.Name: ~MC - Warrior~

~MR - Bertle~.Cost: -1 Max Health and -1 Max Health per Level
~MR - Bertle~.Effect: You gain all Bertle starting Abilities.
~MR - Bertle~.Name: ~MR - Bertle~

~MR - Davel~.Effect: You gain all Davel starting Abilities.
~MR - Davel~.Name: ~MR - Davel~

~MR - Dragonborn~.Effect: You gain all Dragonborn starting Abilities and one breath shape Ability.
~MR - Dragonborn~.Name: ~MR - Dragonborn~

~MR - Dwarf~.Effect: You gain all Dwarf starting Abilities.
~MR - Dwarf~.Name: ~MR - Dwarf~

~MR - Elf~.Effect: You gain all Elf starting Abilities.
~MR - Elf~.Name: ~MR - Elf~

~MR - Gnome~.Effect: You gain all Gnome starting Abilities. Congratulations!
~MR - Gnome~.Name: ~MR - Gnome~

~MR - Hollow~.Effect: You gain all Hollow starting Abilities.
~MR - Hollow~.Name: ~MR - Hollow~

~MR - Orc~.Effect: You gain all Orc starting Abilities.
~MR - Orc~.Name: ~MR - Orc~
